Class Controls

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.Controls
public final class Controls extends Object
Utility class for creating and managing UI controls.

    • comboBox

      public static <T> ComboBoxBuilder<T> comboBox(Collection<T> values)
      Creates a new instance of ComboBoxBuilder using the provided collection of values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the items in the ComboBox
      Parameters:
      values - a collection of values to be included in the combo box
      Returns:
      a new instance of ComboBoxBuilder initialized with the given values

    • choiceMenu

      public static <T> ChoiceMenuBuilder<T> choiceMenu(Collection<T> values)
      Creates and returns a new instance of ChoiceMenuBuilder with the specified collection of values.

      Use an ObservableList for values to automatically update menu items.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the collection.
      Parameters:
      values - The collection of values to be presented in the choice menu.
      Returns:
      A ChoiceMenuBuilder instance initialized with the given collection of values.

    • menuItem

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static javafx.scene.control.MenuItem menuItem(String text, Runnable action, boolean enabled)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use menuItem() instead
      Create new MenuItem.

      NOTE: the enabled state is permanent. Use this method only for menus where the menu state will not be changed, for example, in context menus. If the state is dynamic, use the overload taking an ObservableBooleanValue instead.

      Parameters:
      text - the text to show
      action - the action to perform when the menu item is invoked
      enabled - the property controlling the enabled state
      Returns:
      new menu item

    • menuItem

      Create new MenuItem.
      Parameters:

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static javafx.scene.control.MenuItem menuItem(@Nullable String text, @Nullable javafx.scene.Node graphic, Runnable action, boolean enabled)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use menuItem() instead
      Create new MenuItem.

      NOTE: the enabled state is permanent. Use this method only for menus where the menu state will not be changed, for example, in context menus. If the state is dynamic, use the overload taking an ObservableBooleanValue instead.

      Parameters:
      text - the text to show
      graphic - the graphic to show before the text
      action - the action to perform when the menu item is invoked
      enabled - the enabled state
      Returns:
      new menu item

    • checkMenuItem

    • choiceMenu

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends @Nullable Object> javafx.scene.control.Menu choiceMenu(@Nullable String text, @Nullable javafx.scene.Node graphic, javafx.beans.value.ObservableBooleanValue enabled, javafx.beans.property.Property<T> property, Collection<T> values)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use choiceMenu(Collection) instead
      Creates a choice menu with selectable options based on a property and a collection of possible values.

      The menu allows the user to choose one of the provided values, and the selection is reflected in the associated property. Each choice is represented as a check menu item, and the menu can be disabled based on the provided enabled value.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the values and the associated property
      Parameters:
      text - the text to display as the label of the menu; can be null if graphic is not null
      graphic - a Node to display as the graphic of the menu; can be null if text is not null
      enabled - an observable value controlling whether the menu is enabled or disabled
      property - the property that reflects the currently selected menu option
      values - the collection of possible values to be presented as menu options
      Returns:
      the created Menu object populated with selectable items
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if both text and graphic are null

    • choiceMenu

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends @Nullable Object> javafx.scene.control.Menu choiceMenu(String text, javafx.beans.value.ObservableBooleanValue enabled, javafx.beans.property.Property<T> property, Collection<T> values)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use choiceMenu(Collection) instead
      Creates a menu with a set of selectable choices based on the provided values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the values and the associated property
      Parameters:
      text - the title or label for the menu
      enabled - an observable boolean value indicating if the menu should be enabled or disabled
      property - the property to be bound to the selected value in the menu
      values - the collection of values to populate the menu choices
      Returns:
      the constructed menu object with the specified properties and choices

    • choiceMenu

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends @Nullable Object> javafx.scene.control.Menu choiceMenu(javafx.scene.Node graphic, javafx.beans.value.ObservableBooleanValue enabled, javafx.beans.property.Property<T> property, Collection<T> values)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use choiceMenu(Collection) instead
      Creates and returns a menu with choices derived from the provided collection of values. This method associates the menu with a specified property that reflects the current selection.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the values and the associated property
      Parameters:
      graphic - the graphical representation to be displayed with the menu
      enabled - an observable boolean value indicating whether the menu is enabled
      property - a property that represents the selected value in the menu
      values - the collection of selectable values to be displayed in the menu
      Returns:
      a new Menu instance configured with the specified options and behavior

    • choiceMenu

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends @Nullable Object> javafx.scene.control.Menu choiceMenu(String text, javafx.beans.property.Property<T> property, Collection<T> values)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use choiceMenu(Collection) instead
      Creates a menu with selectable choices based on the provided text, property, and values. The menu allows selection of items from the given collection of values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the values and the associated property
      Parameters:
      text - the label or prompt text for the menu
      property - the property to bind the selected value to
      values - the collection of values to populate the menu with
      Returns:
      a Menu object populated with the specified choices

    • choiceMenu

      @Deprecated(since="21", forRemoval=true) public static <T extends @Nullable Object> javafx.scene.control.Menu choiceMenu(javafx.scene.Node graphic, javafx.beans.property.Property<T> property, Collection<T> values)
      Deprecated, for removal: This API element is subject to removal in a future version.
      use choiceMenu(Collection) instead
      Creates a menu allowing users to choose from a collection of values and bind the selected value to a property.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of items in the menu
      Parameters:
      graphic - the graphic node to be displayed alongside the menu items, can be null
      property - the property to which the selected value will be bound
      values - the collection of available values to choose from
      Returns:
      a Menu instance populated with the provided values
